members.member: Compares two dictionaries for equality by content, as F# maps would.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.DestroyOptions
member.summary: Options controlling the behavior of an operation.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.CancelEvent
member.summary: is emitted when the user initiates a cancellation of the update in progress, or the update successfully completes.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.DiagnosticEvent
member.summary: is emitted whenever a diagnostic message is provided, for example errors from a cloud resource provider while trying to create or update a resource.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.DiagnosticEvent.Severity
member.summary: Severity is one of "info", "info#err", "warning", or "error".

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.DiffKind
member.summary: describes the kind of a particular property diff.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Automation.Events.DiffKind.Add
member.summary: Add indicates that the property was added.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Automation.Events.DiffKind.AddReplace
member.summary: AddReplace indicates that the property was added and requires that the resource be replaced.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Automation.Events.DiffKind.Delete
member.summary: Delete indicates that the property was deleted.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Automation.Events.DiffKind.DeleteReplace
member.summary: DeleteReplace indicates that the property was deleted and requires that the resource be replaced.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Automation.Events.DiffKind.Update
member.summary: Update indicates that the property was updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Automation.Events.DiffKind.UpdateReplace
member.summary: UpdateReplace indicates that the property was updated and requires that the resource be replaced.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.EngineEvent
member.summary: describes a Pulumi engine event, such as a change to a resource or diagnostic message. EngineEvent is a discriminated union of all possible event types, and exactly one field will be non-null.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.EngineEvent.Sequence
member.summary:
Sequence is a unique, and monotonically increasing number for each engine event sent to the Pulumi Service. Since events may be sent concurrently, and/or delayed via network routing, the sequence number is to ensure events can be placed into a total ordering.
- No two events can have the same sequence number.
- Events with a lower sequence number must have been emitted before those with a higher sequence number.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.EngineEvent.Timestamp
member.summary: Timestamp is a Unix timestamp (seconds) of when the event was emitted.

members.member: Stops the polling loop and awaits the background task. Any exceptions encountered in the background task will be propagated to the caller of this method.
Exposed for testing; use Stop instead.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.PolicyEvent
member.summary: is emitted whenever there is Policy violation.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.PolicyEvent.EnforcementLevel
member.summary: EnforcementLevel is one of "warning" or "mandatory"

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.PreludeEvent
member.summary: is emitted at the start of an update.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.PreludeEvent.Config
member.summary: Config contains the keys and values for the update. Encrypted configuration values may be blinded.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.PropertyDiff
member.summary: describes the difference between a single property's old and new values.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.PropertyDiff.Kind
member.summary: Kind is the kind of difference.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.PropertyDiff.InputDiff
member.summary: InputDiff is true if this is a difference between old and new inputs rather than old state and new inputs.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.ResourceOperationFailedEvent
member.summary: is emitted when a resource operation fails. Typically a is emitted before this event, indiciating what the root cause of the error.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.ResourceOutputsEvent
member.summary: is emitted when a resource is finished being provisioned.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.ResourcePreEvent
member.summary: is emitted before a resource is modified.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StandardOutputEngineEvent
member.summary: is emitted whenever a generic message is written, for example warnings from the pulumi CLI itself. Less common than .

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventMetadata
member.summary: describes a "step" within the Pulumi engine, which is any concrete action to migrate a set of cloud resources from one state to another.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventMetadata.Op
member.summary: Op is the operation being performed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventMetadata.Old
member.summary: Old is the state of the resource before performing the step.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventMetadata.New
member.summary: New is the state of the resource after performing the step.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventMetadata.Keys
member.summary: Keys causing a replacement (only applicable for "create" and "replace" Ops).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventMetadata.Diffs
member.summary: Keys that changed with this step.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventMetadata.DetailedDiff
member.summary: The diff for this step as a list of property paths and difference types.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventMetadata.Logical
member.summary: Logical is set if the step is a logical operation in the program.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventMetadata.Provider
member.summary: Provider actually performing the step.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata
member.summary: is the more detailed state information for a resource as it relates to a step(s) being performed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata.Custom
member.summary: Custom indicates if the resource is managed by a plugin.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata.Delete
member.summary: Delete is true when the resource is pending deletion due to a replacement.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata.Id
member.summary: ID is the resource's unique ID, assigned by the resource provider (or blank if none/uncreated).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata.Parent
member.summary: Parent is an optional parent URN that this resource belongs to.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata.Protect
member.summary: Protect is true to "protect" this resource (protected resources cannot be deleted).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata.Inputs
member.summary: Inputs contains the resource's input properties (as specified by the program). Secrets have filtered out, and large assets have been replaced by hashes as applicable.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata.Outputs
member.summary: Outputs contains the resource's complete output state (as returned by the resource provider).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata.Provider
member.summary: Provider is the resource's provider reference

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.StepEventStateMetadata.InitErrors
member.summary: InitErrors is the set of errors encountered in the process of initializing resource.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Events.SummaryEvent
member.summary: is emitted at the end of an update, with a summary of the changes made.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.SummaryEvent.MaybeCorrupt
member.summary: MaybeCorrupt is set if one or more of the resources is in an invalid state.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.SummaryEvent.DurationSeconds
member.summary: Duration is the number of seconds the update was executing.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.SummaryEvent.ResourceChanges
member.summary: ResourceChanges contains the count for resource change by type.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Events.SummaryEvent.PolicyPacks
member.summary: PolicyPacks run during update. Maps PolicyPackName -> version.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Exceptions.ProjectSettingsConflictException
member.summary:
Thrown when creating a Workspace detects a conflict between project settings found on disk (such as Pulumi.yaml) and a ProjectSettings object passed to the Create API.
There are two resolutions:
(A) to use the ProjectSettings, delete the Pulumi.yaml file from WorkDir or use a different WorkDir
(B) to use the exiting Pulumi.yaml from WorkDir, avoid customizing the ProjectSettings

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Exceptions.ProjectSettingsConflictException.SettingsFileLocation
member.summary: FullPath of the Pulumi.yaml (or Pulumi.yml, Pulumi.json) settings file found on disk.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.HistoryOptions
member.summary: Options controlling the behavior of a operation.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.LocalProgramArgs
member.summary: Description of a stack backed by pre-existing local Pulumi CLI program.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspace
member.summary:
LocalWorkspace is a default implementation of the Workspace interface.
A Workspace is the execution context containing a single Pulumi project, a program, and multiple stacks.Workspaces are used to manage the execution environment, providing various utilities such as plugin installation, environment configuration ($PULUMI_HOME), and creation, deletion, and listing of Stacks.
LocalWorkspace relies on Pulumi.yaml and Pulumi.{stack}.yaml as the intermediate format for Project and Stack settings.Modifying ProjectSettings will alter the Workspace Pulumi.yaml file, and setting config on a Stack will modify the Pulumi.{stack}.yaml file. This is identical to the behavior of Pulumi CLI driven workspaces.
If not provided a working directory - causing LocalWorkspace to create a temp directory, than the temp directory will be cleaned up on .

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspace.CreateAsync(Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a workspace using the specified options. Used for maximal control and customization of the underlying environment before any stacks are created or selected.
member.param: Options used to configure the workspace.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspace.CreateStackAsync(Pulumi.Automation.InlineProgramArgs)
member.summary: Creates a Stack with a utilizing the specified inline (in process) . This program is fully debuggable and runs in process. If no option is specified, default project settings will be created on behalf of the user. Similarly, unless a option is specified, the working directory will default to a new temporary directory provided by the OS.
member.param: A set of arguments to initialize a Stack with an inline program that runs in process, as well as any additional customizations to be applied to the workspace.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspace.CreateStackAsync(Pulumi.Automation.InlineProgramArgs,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a Stack with a utilizing the specified inline (in process) . This program is fully debuggable and runs in process. If no option is specified, default project settings will be created on behalf of the user. Similarly, unless a option is specified, the working directory will default to a new temporary directory provided by the OS.
member.param: A set of arguments to initialize a Stack with an inline program that runs in process, as well as any additional customizations to be applied to the workspace.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspace.CreateStackAsync(Pulumi.Automation.LocalProgramArgs)
member.summary: Creates a Stack with a utilizing the local Pulumi CLI program from the specified . This is a way to create drivers on top of pre-existing Pulumi programs. This Workspace will pick up any available Settings files(Pulumi.yaml, Pulumi.{stack}.yaml).
member.param: A set of arguments to initialize a Stack with a pre-configured Pulumi CLI program that already exists on disk, as well as any additional customizations to be applied to the workspace.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspace.CreateStackAsync(Pulumi.Automation.LocalProgramArgs,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a Stack with a utilizing the local Pulumi CLI program from the specified . This is a way to create drivers on top of pre-existing Pulumi programs. This Workspace will pick up any available Settings files(Pulumi.yaml, Pulumi.{stack}.yaml).
member.param: A set of arguments to initialize a Stack with a pre-configured Pulumi CLI program that already exists on disk, as well as any additional customizations to be applied to the workspace.

Similarly, unless a option is specified, the working directory will default to a new temporary directory provided by the OS.
member.param: A set of arguments to initialize a Stack with an inline program that runs in process, as well as any additional customizations to be applied to the workspace.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions
member.summary: Extensibility options to configure a LocalWorkspace; e.g: settings to seed and environment variables to pass through to every command.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions.WorkDir
member.summary: The directory to run Pulumi commands and read settings (Pulumi.yaml and Pulumi.{stack}.yaml).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions.PulumiHome
member.summary: The directory to override for CLI metadata.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions.SecretsProvider
member.summary:
The secrets provider to user for encryption and decryption of stack secrets.
See: https://www.pulumi.com/docs/intro/concepts/config/#available-encryption-providers

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions.Program
member.summary:
The inline program to be used for Preview/Update operations if any.
If none is specified, the stack will refer to for this information.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions.Logger
member.summary: A custom logger instance that will be used for inline programs. Note that it will only be used if is also provided.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions.EnvironmentVariables
member.summary: Environment values scoped to the current workspace. These will be supplied to every Pulumi command.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions.ProjectSettings
member.summary:
The settings object for the current project.
If provided when initializing a project settings file will be written to when the workspace is initialized via .

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.LocalWorkspaceOptions.StackSettings
member.summary:
A map of Stack names and corresponding settings objects.
If provided when initializing stack settings file(s) will be written to when the workspace is initialized via .

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.ProjectRuntimeOptions.TypeScript
member.summary:
Applies to NodeJS projects only.
A boolean that controls whether to use ts-node to execute sources.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.ProjectRuntimeOptions.Binary
member.summary:
Applies to Go and .NET project only.
Go: A string that specifies the name of a pre-build executable to look for on your path.
.NET: A string that specifies the path of a pre-build .NET assembly.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.ProjectRuntimeOptions.VirtualEnv
member.summary:
Applies to Python projects only.
A string that specifies the path to a virtual environment to use when running the program.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.StackDeployment
member.summary:
Represents the state of a stack deployment as used by ExportStackAsync and ImportStackAsync.
There is no strongly typed model for the contents yet, but you can access the raw representation via the Json property.
NOTE: instances may contain sensitive data (secrets).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.StackDeployment.Version
member.summary: Version indicates the schema of the encoded deployment.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.StackDeployment.Json
member.summary: JSON representation of the deployment.

member.summary: This stack's secrets provider.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.StackSettings.EncryptedKey
member.summary: This is the KMS-encrypted ciphertext for the data key used for secrets encryption. Only used for cloud-based secrets providers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.StackSettings.EncryptionSalt
member.summary: This is this stack's base64 encoded encryption salt. Only used for passphrase-based secrets providers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.StackSettings.Config
member.summary: This is an optional configuration bag.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace
member.summary:
Workspace is the execution context containing a single Pulumi project, a program, and multiple stacks.
Workspaces are used to manage the execution environment, providing various utilities such as plugin installation, environment configuration ($PULUMI_HOME), and creation, deletion, and listing of Stacks.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.WorkDir
member.summary: The working directory to run Pulumi CLI commands.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.PulumiHome
member.summary:
The directory override for CLI metadata if set.
This customizes the location of $PULUMI_HOME where metadata is stored and plugins are installed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.PulumiVersion
member.summary: The version of the underlying Pulumi CLI/Engine.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.SecretsProvider
member.summary:
The secrets provider to use for encryption and decryption of stack secrets.
See: https://www.pulumi.com/docs/intro/concepts/config/#available-encryption-providers

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.Program
member.summary:
The inline program to be used for Preview/Update operations if any.
If none is specified, the stack will refer to for this information.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.Logger
member.summary: A custom logger instance that will be used for the action. Note that it will only be used if is also provided.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.EnvironmentVariables
member.summary: Environment values scoped to the current workspace. These will be supplied to every Pulumi command.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.GetProjectSettingsAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns project settings for the current project if any.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.SaveProjectSettingsAsync(Pulumi.Automation.ProjectSettings,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Overwrites the settings for the current project.
There can only be a single project per workspace. Fails if new project name does not match old.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.GetStackSettingsAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns stack settings for the stack matching the specified stack name if any.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.SaveStackSettingsAsync(System.String,Pulumi.Automation.StackSettings,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Overwrite the settings for the stack matching the specified stack name.
member.param: The name of the stack to operate on.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.SerializeArgsForOpAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Hook to provide additional args to every CLI command before they are executed.
Provided with a stack name, returns an array of args to append to an invoked command ["--config=...", ].
does not utilize this extensibility point.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.PostCommandCallbackAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Hook executed after every command. Called with the stack name.
An extensibility point to perform workspace cleanup (CLI operations may create/modify a Pulumi.stack.yaml).
does not utilize this extensibility point.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.GetConfigAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns the value associated with the specified stack name and key, scoped to the Workspace.
member.param: The name of the stack to read config from.
The key to use for the config lookup.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.GetAllConfigAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns the config map for the specified stack name, scoped to the current Workspace.
member.param: The name of the stack to read config from.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.Workspace.SetConfigAsync(System.String,System.String,Pulumi.Automation.ConfigValue,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sets the specified key-value pair in the provided stack's config.
member.param: The name of the stack to operate on.

Returns all stacks created under the current project.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Automation.WorkspaceStack
member.summary:
is an isolated, independently configurable instance of a Pulumi program. exposes methods for the full pulumi lifecycle (up/preview/refresh/destroy), as well as managing configuration.
Multiple stacks are commonly used to denote different phases of development (such as development, staging, and production) or feature branches (such as feature-x-dev, jane-feature-x-dev).
Will dispose the on .

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.WorkspaceStack.Name
member.summary: The name identifying the Stack.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Automation.WorkspaceStack.Workspace
member.summary: The Workspace the Stack was created from.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.WorkspaceStack.CreateAsync(System.String,Pulumi.Automation.Workspace,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a new stack using the given workspace, and stack name. It fails if a stack with that name already exists.
member.param: The Workspace the Stack was created from.
member.exception: If a stack with the provided name already exists.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.WorkspaceStack.SelectAsync(System.String,Pulumi.Automation.Workspace,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Selects stack using the given workspace, and stack name. It returns an error if the given Stack does not exist.
member.param: The Workspace the Stack was created from.
member.exception: If a stack with the provided name does not exists.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.WorkspaceStack.CreateOrSelectAsync(System.String,Pulumi.Automation.Workspace,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Tries to create a new Stack using the given workspace, and stack name if the stack does not already exist, or falls back to selecting an existing stack. If the stack does not exist, it will be created and selected.
member.param: The name of the identifying stack.
The Workspace the Stack was created from.

Creates or updates the resources in a stack by executing the program in the Workspace.

member.summary: Compares the current stacks resource state with the state known to exist in the actual cloud provider. Any such changes are adopted into the current stack.
member.param: Options to customize the behavior of the refresh.

Exports the deployment state of the stack.
This can be combined with ImportStackAsync to edit a stack's state (such as recovery from failed deployments).

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.WorkspaceStack.ImportStackAsync(Pulumi.Automation.StackDeployment,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

Imports the specified deployment state into a pre-existing stack.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Automation.WorkspaceStack.CancelAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Cancel stops a stack's currently running update. It throws an exception if no update is currently running. Note that this operation is _very dangerous_, and may leave the stack in an inconsistent state if a resource operation was pending when the update was canceled. This command is not supported for local backends.
